unit: Unit 4 | Probability, Random Variables, and Probability Distributions
title: Find the Binomial Situation
question_text: Which of the following situations represents a binomial situation?

choices.text: Andy is thinking of a number between 1 1 and 10 10 . Melissa has 3 3 attempts to guess the number.
Myra is looking for peaches at the supermarket. She inspects several peaches until she finds 3 3 that she is satisfied with.
Tanya asks 8 8 of her neighbors to rate their satisfaction with the local cable company on a scale from 1 1 to 10 10 .
The local cable company mails surveys to 250 250 of its customers to determine the proportion of them who say they are satisfied with the company's services.
Jared surveys 10 10 randomly selected people and asks them what their favorite sport is. He counts the number who say “baseball”.
